SEARCH
Package com.rikuthin.data

Class BulletRepository

java.lang.Object
com.rikuthin.data.BulletRepository
public class BulletRepository extends Object
Implements the **Repository pattern** as a singleton, providing centralized access and management for all currently active Bullet objects in the game world.

This class serves as the single source of truth for the game's active bullet population. It protects the integrity of the collection by exposing a read-only view via getBullets() and requiring explicit mutation methods (like addBullet(Bullet) and removeIf(Predicate)) for modification.

    • getInstance

      public static BulletRepository getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of the BulletRepository.
      Returns:
      The BulletRepository instance.

    • getBullets

      public Set<Bullet> getBullets()
      /** Returns an unmodifiable/read-only view of the stored Bullet objects.

      Modifications must be done via the repository's explicit mutation methods (e.g., addBullet, removeIf).

      Returns:
      The active bullets.

    • addBullet

      public void addBullet(Bullet bullet)
      Adds a new Bullet instance to the repository's collection of active bullets.

      The bullet is added only if the provided argument is not null.

      Parameters:
      bullet - The new Bullet instance to store.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the GameManager is not in the required RUNNING state.

    • removeBullet

      public boolean removeBullet(Bullet bullet)
      Removes a specific Bullet instance from the repository.
      Parameters:
      bullet - The bullet to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the bullet was present and successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • removeIf

      public int removeIf(Predicate<Bullet> filter)
      Removes any Bullet objects from storage which meet the given filter's requirements.
      Parameters:
      filter - A boolean-valued function which serves as a filter.
      Returns:
      The number of bullets removed.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all stored bullets from the repository.

    • countBullets

      public int countBullets()
      Counts the number of stored Bullet objects.
      Returns:
      The number of bullets stored.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks whether the repository is empty (has no elements).
      Returns:
      true if there are no elements; otherwise false.
